text:
Hello,
I created a module that is a mix of hubl and HTML.

I am using it in my emails. What is the best way to insert media queries/ style classes in a partial module ?
I need to make it responsive, and not sure if i should be adding a header in it
If you group some fields together you can just click on the group and go down to the repeat options in DM. If you're working locally you'll want to add the “Occurrence” object to the group field.

Unfortunately, if you’re trying to do this in a drag-and-drop email you’re not going to be able to add responsive styling. If it is a coded email, you’ll need to add any responsive styles to a tag in the head.

Thanks <@U9KA594Q3> and <@U02J1440N13> I think my scenario is a little different. I would have to maintain the existing rows in HubDB and update them. There will also be additional columns in the row that will be populated manually in HubDB that will NOT exist in the feed. I think this may be a little much. Appreciate the responses
